title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [27 february 1867]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [27 February 1867]
text: 27 Feb '67februyFebruary 27 my dear walti feel as if i must write a few lines every time i get a letter i cantcan't feel satisfied untilluntil i write sometimes i think its real foolish to write every week but if i dontdon't it seems as if i had something to doodo that i had neglected my wrist hurts me so bad i have got JeffsJeff's gold pen i didentdidn't know but it would help me along but iami am so afraid of injuring it that i dontdon't know as it will doodo me much good) i got your letter Walt and money to day all right it is very warm here now for the time of year but very muddy i never go out any where except around the door i am midling well sometimes i think imI'm real sick but it goes over i have been troubled with a pain in my side i have had a mustard plaisterplaster on part of the time i thought it helpthelped me some but i feel my age more this winter than i ever did before of course imI'm older but i seem to be so tired every day the children annoy me very much there is no time to read nor any quiet they almost live up stairs i like them of course but i get very tired of them they are very wild and noisy matty has no help at present but is to have a colored girl on mondayMonday they expect the masons here next week to make a visit) george was up to day as usual he seldom misses he comes up in the lumber waggon he has put his houses in an agentsagent's hands to sell he says he feels real poor they owe considerable but if they sell i suppose they will come out square and not much more every thing is so costly the plumbing and painting and they pay the most of the men 3 Â½ dollars per day walt you may laughflaugh at this figure three it looks a little like a comic picture i cantcan't help but laughflaugh myself O walt i got the almanacks i have been trying to get one ever since new year sNew Year's i sent by Jeff and matt and george so many times i told them at last i was going to send to washington i wanted to see about the moon and the sun rising and all) i am going to try to write a letter to mary i expect she thinks we have all forgotten her as to han i dontdon't know as i shall ever get a letter from her i will try to write to her before long) write walt how you like your new boarding house and O the poor soldiers i doodo so hope that poor fellow will live it is so sad to suffer so much) i think walt JeffsJeff's visit yes it has done him goodgood bie Walt till i write again Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [27 February 1867]
